message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.AR. 

The paper discusses beam management techniques for mmWave cellular networks, which involves topics related to network infrastructure (base stations), wireless communication (channel variations, link budget), and control layer procedures (initial access, handover, beam tracking). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses measurement techniques and control schemes, which are related to information theory (cs.IT) and system and control theory (cs.SY). The use of highly directional antennas and the need for precise alignment also falls under the category of multimedia (cs.MM). Finally, the paper discusses the implications of beam management on the overall network architecture, which could be categorized under cs.AR (Hardware Architecture).
